subject: Web3
title: Conflict Minerals Tracking
description: A short lesson to help you apply Conflict Minerals Tracking.

hook.text: Minerals like cobalt and coltan often come from war zones where child labor is common. Blockchain can trace their origins.

buildup.text: Companies like De Beers use blockchain to track diamonds from mine to retail, proving they're conflict-free.

discovery.text: Each stone gets a digital record of its journey. Buyers can verify the diamond wasn't sourced from exploitation.

twist.text: Critics say the system depends on honest reporting at the mine. Blockchain records data â€” it doesn't verify truth.

climax.text: Blockchain doesn't end conflict mining, but it makes the supply chain more transparent and harder to deceive.

punchline.text: Blockchain can track a diamond's journey. It can't guarantee honesty at the start.

quiz.question: What limitation does blockchain face in tracking conflict minerals?
options: It records data but can't verify the truthfulness of inputs at the source
